abstract.shortdesc: Task short descriptions define the benefits of performing the tasks. They answer the question Why?. If relevant, they also state who may perform the actions, when and where.

rule.rule-statement: Define the purpose/benefits of tasks. Do not simply repeat the title or state the obvious.

examplefig.codeblock:
<task> <title>Add users</title> <shortdesc>Define user profiles, passwords and access rights.</shortdesc> ... </task>
<task> <title>Add users</title> <shortdesc>Login as administrator to define user profiles, passwords and access rights.</shortdesc> ... </task>
<task><title>Add external users to a project</title> <shortdesc>Allow individual users, who are not part of your team, read or write access to a project's resources.</shortdesc> ... </task>
<task><title>Take a picture</title> <shortdesc>Take pictures in different formats from regular size to panoramic, with or without flash.</shortdesc> ... </task>
<task><title>Configure news monitoring</title> <shortdesc>Stay up to date. Define subjects of interest and receive hourly, daily or weekly email notifications that summarize the latest news and provide links to original articles.</shortdesc> ... </task>

<task> <title>Add users</title> <shortdesc>Add users to the system.</shortdesc> ... </task>
<task><title>Take a picture</title> <shortdesc>Learn how to take a picture.</shortdesc> ... </task>

rule.rule-statement: Do not reference a publication's structure in short descriptions.
